body_html:
The commit point is Aug 1st, which is partially post 1.3. The patch works with the 1.3 branch/tag as well. The PRs are in progress from NVIDIA. The eigen PR for CUDA 9RC is in review by the external eigen team.
…
On Aug 26, 2017 1:45 AM, "Dominik Schlösser" ***@***.***> wrote: Any updates on this? While the patch works with the specific tf-commit (also with Python3), the tf version says *version* is 1.2.1-rc1, so rather old (that version was incompatible with current bazel 0.5.3, so bazel needs to be downgraded in order to build the tf-patch version.) The cudnn 7 changes so far are not included in HEAD. Any possibility for a branch that supports the most recent released upstream software/drivers? — You are receiving this because you were assigned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#12474 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AWZeslZ2gAsAXT2MmYkdgvLNHyoZoeWYks5sb9sjgaJpZM4O-GMz> .

The commit point is Aug 1st, which is partially post 1.3. The patch works
with the 1.3 branch/tag as well.  The PRs are in progress from NVIDIA.
The eigen PR for CUDA 9RC is in review by the external eigen team.

 bazel needs to be downgraded in order to build the tf-patch version.) The

body:
The commit point is Aug 1st, which is partially post 1.3. The patch works
with the 1.3 branch/tag as well.  The PRs are in progress from NVIDIA.
The eigen PR for CUDA 9RC is in review by the external eigen team.

On Aug 26, 2017 1:45 AM, "Dominik Schlösser" <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Any updates on this? While the patch works with the specific tf-commit
> (also with Python3), the tf version says *version* is 1.2.1-rc1, so
> rather old (that version was incompatible with current bazel 0.5.3, so
> bazel needs to be downgraded in order to build the tf-patch version.) The
> cudnn 7 changes so far are not included in HEAD. Any possibility for a
> branch that supports the most recent released upstream software/drivers?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were assigned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/12474#issuecomment-325103656>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AWZeslZ2gAsAXT2MmYkdgvLNHyoZoeWYks5sb9sjgaJpZM4O-GMz>
> .
